main event: An unidentified flying object was observed for 10 minutes over Motobu Peninsula, Okinawa, on 27 March 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as metallic and disc-shaped, measuring approximately 40-50 ft in diameter., The object was observed at an altitude of 33,000 ft and was estimated to be traveling at 750 mph., The operator observed the object through binoculars., The object was described to have no visible means of propulsion and appeared to hover before accelerating and disappearing., There were no physical evidences or photographs related to the sighting.
witness description: Radar operator, superior observer with 15 years of military service
